definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: You just opened the door to temptation and let Sloane walk through it ?
sentences.chinese: 你就這樣打開了誘惑之門讓斯隆大搖大擺了走了進去？

sentences.english: He was strutting the hall of business when the boss talked to me.
sentences.chinese: 老闆跟我談話時，他在營業大廳裏大搖大擺地走過。

sentences.english: He strutted up and down before the manager.
sentences.chinese: 他在經理面前大搖大擺地走來走去。
他大搖大擺地進了我家。

sentences.english: But the mood in Berlin is not sunny, or swaggering.
sentences.chinese: 但柏林的情緒就沒有那麼陽光，亦或是大搖大擺了。

sentences.english: They swaggered down the street, hooking on each other.
sentences.chinese: 他們互相挽着手臂大搖大擺地沿着大街走去。

sentences.english: He pranced out of the room in a fury.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下大搖大擺走出了房間。

sentences.english: He walked into the malones' flat as bold as brass .
sentences.chinese: 他大搖大擺走進馬龍家的一套房間。

sentences.english: He strutted about the street like a gaudy fighting cock.
sentences.chinese: 他在街上大搖大擺地走，像一隻絢麗好鬥的公雞。

sentences.english: Obviously the thief had simply walked out this way as bold as brass.
sentences.chinese: 顯然賊人是從這裏大搖大擺出去的。

sentences.english: What makes you think you can just walk in there and fnd what we need?
sentences.chinese: 你憑什麼以爲自己能大搖大擺地走進去爲所欲爲呢？

definition: not to glance sideways (idiom)/to gaze fixedly/to be fully concentrated/to preserve a correct attitude
erhua variant of 一股腦|一股脑[yi1 gu3 nao3]
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
